intro: Kallstroemia hintonii, commonly known as Hinton's kallstroemia, is a rare flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in Texas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
